structure.unit: Crimes, Punishments And Proceedingsin Criminal Cases

law.catch_line: Indictment For Criminal Dealing With Personal Property
law.text: In an indictment for criminal dealing with personal property with intent to steal, an allegation that the defendant stole said property shall be sufficient; and such indictment may be supported by proof that the defendant committed larceny of the property, or embezzled it, or obtained it by false pretences.
